metadata.title: CVE-2012-3971 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Summer Institute of Linguistics (SIL) Graphite 2, as used in MozillaFirefox before 15.0, Thunderbird before 15.0, and SeaMonkey before 2.12,allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial ofservice (memory corruption) via vectors related to the (1)Silf::readClassMap and (2) Pass::readPass functions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3971` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-testsuite - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 15.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libgraphite2-3 - 1.2.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '15.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '15.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
graphite2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.1-1').
